description: Smartmatic sued Newsmax for defamation over false claims related to the 2020 presidential election. The trial was supposed to begin next week.
title: Voting-tech company settles with right-wing network over false election claims

description: With Israel and Hezbollah locked in the fiercest fighting in decades, many Lebanese have taken refuge in schools, hotels and other shelters.
title: Over 90,000 people in Lebanon had to flee Israel's bombardments this week

description: The Food and Drug Administration is expected to approve KarXT, the first new type of drug for schizophrenia in decades. It appears to be effective, but its main advantage is milder side effects.
title: The FDA is expected to approve a new type of schizophrenia drug

description:
The war between Israel and Hamas in Gaza approaches the one year mark. Violence between Israel and Hezbollah in Lebanon continues to escalate. And there are fears that Iran will get deeply involved with these conflicts. In a volatile moment in the region, Jordan balances a unique set of relationships with all these countries. We hear from Ayman Safadi, who is Jordan's Deputy Prime Minister and Foreign Minister, about what he thinks it will take to end the conflicts.

For more coverage of differing views on these conflicts, go to npr.org/mideastupdates
title: Jordan's Unique Position in a Region at War

description: The Republican congressman has been criticized for amplifying false claims about Haitian immigrants. "You never want to intentionally hurt someone’s feelings," he apologized in part on Thursday.
title: Louisiana Rep. Clay Higgins walks back racist comments about Haitians after backlash

description: A new study shows 3D imaging found potentially serious cancers earlier and reduced the need for callback for further screening.
title: 3D mammograms show benefits over 2D imaging, especially for dense breasts

description: New Yorker writer Andrew Marantz visited Michigan to understand the uncommitted movement, a group of pro-Palestinian, anti-war activists and voters who emerged during the 2024 Democratic primary.
title: Could 'uncommitted' voters sway the election?

description: Hurricane Helene continues to strengthen as it approaches the Florida coast. Member stations across the NPR network are covering the local impact as Helene barrels through the southeast U.S.
title: How to follow the latest local updates on Hurricane Helene

description: NYC Mayor Eric Adams has been indicted on federal charges after a corruption probe into his administration. And, Hurricane Helene is projected to reach a catastrophic Category 4.
title: NYC Mayor indicted. And, Hurricane Helene expected to be catastrophic

description: As the homelessness crisis grows, it’s common for the public and politicians to conflate homeless encampments and criminal activity. But how much do these camps really affect crime in cities?
title: Politicians often link crime and homelessness. The reality is more complex

description: Oklahoma’s governor waited until the day of Emmanuel Littlejohn’s execution to announce whether he would grant the prisoner clemency. Littlejohn spoke to NPR.
title: 'Governor, don’t kill me for the heck of it': Oklahoma prisoner asks for clemency

description:
Hezbollah is a Lebanese paramilitary organization and political party that's directly supported by the Islamic Republic of Iran. In the wake of the October 7, 2023 Hamas-led attack on Israel, and Israel's invasion of Gaza, there have been escalating attacks between Hezbollah and Israel across the border they share.

Today on the show: a history of Hezbollah.
title: A History of Hezbollah (Throwback)
